answers.answer: You need to tell your dr!! That's dangerous for your baby! You could fall on your stomach!
Thats a bigggg sign of preeclampsia I actually think its called eclampsia
You need to go to the hospital. ASAP.
This could be a sign of a very serious medical condition.  We urge you to go to the E.R. immediately.
you really need to talk to your doctor. the outcome could be worse then what they suggest:/ they might be able to give you something to control them or keep them from happening..
Please go to the doctor ASAP!

You need to go to the ER immediately! And do notdrive. Call 911 and have an ambulance take you. If you've developed eclampsia and have seizures because of it, death is usually not far around the corner. Not truing to scare you but it is that serious.
I see your only 11 weeks but still could be extremely high blood pressure. Have you ever had seizures before
You need to see your doctor!
Good point, knufrio - DO NOT DRIVE.  But get to the E.R. immediately.  Best wishes, and please let us know how you're doing.
that could be life threatening u need to call a doctor immediately

Go straight to the ER and do not hold anything back. Make sure you tell them everything that is going on. every symptom that your feeling. It is very important for you to let your doctor know everything that happens to you not only while your pregnant but in general. I pray that everything is ok with you and please keep us posted!!
Oh my goodness! Yes go to the ER immediately and do not drive. That is very dangerous and can indicate many things. Please keep us updated! Prayers for you and baby!

Also if you've previously had seizures or have epilepsy and just haven't been having seizures, pregnancy can trigger them due to the added stress on your body. I have epilepsy but up until I got pregnant, hadn't had a seizure since I was 13. There are things they can do to help you, especially if they are frequent. Don't be scared, it needs to have addressed before it becomes dangerous (if it hasn't already). Please seek medical care immediately.

You should tell your dr and so ur famiky members can keep an eye on you 24/7. I knew a young lady she was 6months pregnant first time mommy and she would get seizures and she had a seizure in the morning and she fell on her stomach and was hard for her to breathe also...and when they found her she was dead for 3 hours already....it was a very tragic..so please go get checked by your dr you can get medicine for that...

question: I'm suddenly having seizures, and I'm really scared to talk to my doctor about it because I'm afraid of what she will suggest...
title: seizures?
